skill.name: ticktick-cli
skill.description: 使用 Python CLI 与 Dida365 Open API 交互以管理滴答清单任务/项目，适用于需要通过脚本或命令行调用滴答清单接口的场景（如项目/任务的查询、创建、更新、完成、删除）。
skill.summary: 使用 Python CLI 与 Dida365 Open API 交互以管理滴答清单任务/项目，适用于需要通过脚本或命令行调用滴答清单接口的场景（如项目/任务的查询、创建、更新、完成、删除）。
skill.author: DCjanus

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate CLI tool for managing TickTick/Dida365 tasks via the official Open API. The codebase is clean with no malicious code. Risk factors include standard network access to the official Dida365 API endpoints, optional file read capability for JSON input, and environment variable access for configuration. These are all appropriate for a task management CLI.

low_findings.title: Optional file read capability
low_findings.description: The CLI supports reading JSON input from files using the `@path` syntax (line 215-220 in ticktick_cli.py). While this is a legitimate feature for bulk task creation, it means any file readable by the process could be accessed if an attacker controls the command arguments. Code: `if raw.startswith("@"): path = Path(raw[1:]).expanduser()`

low_findings.title: OAuth token passed via environment variable
low_findings.description: The TICKTICK_TOKEN environment variable is used for authentication (line 247 in ticktick_cli.py). Environment variables for credentials are a common and acceptable practice, though users should ensure proper process isolation in shared environments.

content.value_statement: Managing tasks in TickTick/Dida365 through the web interface is slow and repetitive. This skill provides a command-line interface to the official Open API, enabling AI agents and developers to create, update, complete, and delete tasks and projects programmatically with simple commands.
actual_capabilities: List, create, update, and delete projects in your TickTick account
List, create, update, complete, and delete tasks within any project
Add checklist items (subtasks) to tasks with detailed options
Query project data including tasks and kanban columns
Output results in table format or JSON for AI consumption
Configure base URL, timeout, and token via environment variables
limitations: Requires a valid OAuth token from Dida365/TickTick (no built-in auth flow)
Does not support batch operations beyond JSON file input
No search or filtering capabilities within the CLI itself
Output formatting is basic tables or raw JSON without advanced options

use_cases.title: Automate task creation
use_cases.description: AI agents can create tasks, mark them complete, and manage projects without manual web interface access.

use_cases.title: Build task workflows
use_cases.description: Integrate TickTick task management into scripts, CI/CD pipelines, or productivity automation.

use_cases.title: Bulk task operations
use_cases.description: Create multiple tasks from JSON files for tracking shows, books, or any multi-item workflow.

prompt_templates.title: List all projects
prompt_templates.prompt: Use ticktick-cli to list all projects in my TickTick account. Show the project names and IDs in a clear format.

prompt_templates.title: Create a task
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new task in project [PROJECT_ID] with the title "Review PR #123" and set the due date to tomorrow. Mark it as high priority.

prompt_templates.title: Complete task
prompt_templates.prompt: Mark task [TASK_ID] as complete in project [PROJECT_ID]. Use the ticktick-cli complete command.

prompt_templates.title: Bulk import
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a batch of tasks in my "Reading List" project. Use the --item-json option with the @/path/to/tasks.json file containing an array of task objects.

output: Projects list displayed in a formatted table with columns: id, name, color, closed, groupId, viewMode, kind, sortOrder
Or JSON output if --json flag is used

best_practices: Store your TICKTICK_TOKEN securely in environment variables, never in scripts or version control
Use the --json flag when calling from AI agents for easier parsing of results
Test destructive operations like delete with read-only queries first to confirm project and task IDs
anti_patterns: Hardcoding OAuth tokens in scripts or passing them as visible command-line arguments
Using delete commands without verifying the target project or task ID first
Assuming the CLI will prompt for confirmation before destructive operations (it will not)

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with both TickTick and Dida365?
faq.answer: Yes. TickTick and Dida365 are the same service. The API endpoint api.dida365.com works for both accounts.

faq.question: How do I get an OAuth token?
faq.answer: Visit the Dida365 Developer Center to register an OAuth app, then use the provided credentials with the auth flow or set TICKTICK_TOKEN directly.

faq.question: Can I use this with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. Claude Code can invoke the CLI script with appropriate arguments to manage tasks in your TickTick account.

faq.question: Is my token data safe?
faq.answer: Tokens are passed via environment variables or CLI arguments. The skill does not store or transmit tokens to any third-party services beyond the official Dida365 API.

faq.question: Why is my request timing out?
faq.answer: Check your TICKTICK_TIMEOUT setting. The default is 30 seconds. Increase it with --timeout 60s for slower connections.

faq.question: How does this compare to the official web interface?
faq.answer: This CLI provides programmatic access for automation. The web interface is better for manual task management with rich editing features.
